content.description: This is a nice, low-end TR in nearly in the middle of C face.  It has 2 starts as you can go up the right or left side of a flake-ish chunk of rock before the second part.  The reason why I remember this so vividly, is that this route, for some undecipherable reason, was the site of a venture into soloing...which I don't recommend for the newbie.  While it is simply easy to get to the top of the flake, the upper part is less-than-perfectly-secure for the fledgling soloist.  Don't.  Enjoy the TR.
content.protection: A TR or a complete loss of your senses.  There were 2 fixed anchors above this route.
content.location: This goes either right or left of the large triangular flake-like chunk.  Then straight up to the top.

content.description: Climb up the small ledge, and follow a thin, vertical crack to top.
content.location: Start just left of the large flake.

content.description: This is a classic - it climbs The Church of LSD without the pocket. It has razor holds and VERY thin feet, it is a really hard route.
Go through the slab right of the Albatross flake to an overhang. Surmount it, and continue to the top.
content.location: It is right of the Albatross flake on the right side of the cliff below an overhang.

content.description: This goes straight up to where a big, horizontal crack and a diagonal flake meet, halfway up the cliff. Continue up from there.
content.location: It is just left of the ledge.

content.description: Climb smooth tricky face by passing just right of the Double Overhang overlap. Continue straight up.
content.location: It ascends a smooth face a few feet to the right of Double Overhang.

content.description: Climb a slabby part, and continue to the right of the overhang. Go through two drill holes, and top out.
content.location: It is on the right side of the cliff, below and right of an overhang.

content.description: Climb the smooth face past a drill hole to a good undercling on the left side of the flake's point.  Pull over onto the face above, continue past a second roof (good hold above the roof), and finish on the short slab to the top.
content.protection: Top rope anchors located along the top of the wall.
content.location: Immediately left of Double Overhang, starts just below and to the left of a large, down-pointing flake.

content.description: Climb straight up to the large horizontal crack (just where it gets narrower). Continue up.
content.location: It is just right of the right side of the big flake.

content.description: Climb the right side of the big flake. Halfway up the flake, continue straight up instead.
content.location: It goes up the right side of the big flake.

content.description: Climb through middle of the flake, and continue up passing a horizontal crack.
content.location: This is on the flake right of the big flake.

content.description: Climb straight up passing two horizontal cracks and an overlap.
content.location: It is on the far left of the cliff, a few feet left of Blood Streaks.

content.description: Climb to the horizontal crack. Then move right and up slowly joining Blood Streaks for the finish.
content.location: It is on the far left of the cliff, a few feet left of Blood Streaks.

content.description:
Climb through the middle of the big flake to a ledge. Finish up on Yellow Spot, i.e. straight up. 

  The start has multiple harder variations.
content.location: It goes up the middle of the big flake.

content.description: Double Overhang is located on the left side of C Wall - look for the large, down-pointing flake with a pair of roofs above.  Climb the slab below and right of the point to a stance below the flake (good undercling).  Pull over the right side of the flake, climb through a second roof higher up, and finish on a short, polished slab that leads to the top.
content.protection: Top rope anchors located along the top of the wall.

content.description: A lot of routes on C Wall are hard to figure out and have eliminates, this one is clear. This is on the left side by Blood Streaks.
content.location: Climb an obvious, right-facing undercling/sidepull, then lurch up with the left to a poor pocket, using tricky foot work, and go up to a good hold.

content.description: Follow a vertical crack to top. The beginning until first horizontal is tricky.
content.location: This ascends the vertical crack right of Blood Streaks.

content.description: Climb middle of the flake (same as Leap), but then continue just left of Leap to the top.
content.location: This ascends the flake right of the large flake.

content.description: Start on small foot holds and continues with a couple of height dependent moves to the horizontal cracks. The crux is the move to the first crack. It felt easy for the grade, but being 6'1", some moves will be harder for a shorter climber.
content.protection: There are two bolts at the top to set up your anchor.
content.location: This is the route that goes straight up the red paint streaks, hence the name.

content.description:
Climb right side of the flake to a ledge. Continue up to another small ledge at the left side of an overhang. Bypass it, and continue to top.  

  This routes takes pro and is a nice, easier trad lead.
content.location: It ascends the right side of the flake to the right of the big flake.

content.description:
This is a popular section of Quincy Quarries.  The rock is quite slick here, especially on hot days.  In fact, it can be considered a reflector oven during the summer months.  It is probably 35-45 feet tall.  It is also known as Reflector Oven. It does continue with D & E Faces to its right. 

  L->R: 

  A1. Grey Spot Direct, 7+, 1p, TR.   A2. Grey Spot, 5, 1p, TR.   B. Church Of  LSD, 11, 1p, 20', TR.   B eliminate. Temple Of Doom, 12+, 1p, 20', TR.   CA2. Blood Streaks, 9, 1p, 40', TR.   D. Constant Absurdity, 8 (eliminate)   E. Ceaseless Turmoil, 6 or 8, 1p, TR.   F. Orgasm, 7   G. Satisfaction, 7, 1p, 40', TR.   H. Double Overhang, 7, 1p, 40', TR.   I. RubinÂ’s Cube, 10 (contrived eliminate)   J. Sour Grapes, 9 or 10, 1p, TR.   K1. Ripple, 9 or 10   K2. Split Pea, 8, 1p, TR.   L. Sticky Fingers, 8, 1p, TR.   M. Thin Spot, 7, 1p, TR.   N. Yellow Spot, 5, 1p, 40', TR.   ON. Curse You Direct, 10   PN. Flake Direct, 6   Q1N. Yellow Spot alternate start, 5, 1p, 40', TR.   Q2N. Mingled Measure, 6, 1p, TR.   R. Palm, 7, 1p, TR.   S. Leap, 8+, 1p, TR.   T. Albatross, 4, 8+, or 9, 1p, gear or TR.   U. Starlight, 4, 8, or 10, 1p, TR.   V. Small Ceiling, 4, 1p, TR.   W. Fingers, 7   Fingertrip (traverse), 8
